content.html:
Students will complete the following questions to practice the skills they have learned in this lesson.
  1. Write \((x + 6)(x + 5)\) in standard form.
  • \(x^2+10x −30\)
  • \(x^2+11x +30\)
  • \(x^2+30\)
  • \(x^2−11x +30\)

Answer: \(x^2+11x +30\)

  1. Write \((x − 3)(x − 7)\) in standard form.
  • \(x^2+21\)
  • \(x^2+10x −21\)
  • \(x^2+10x +21\)
  • \(x^2−10x +21\)

Answer: \(x^2−10x +21\)

  1. An expression in standard form is shown. The diagram below shows it is equivalent to which expression in factored form?

\(x^2+11x +18\)


 

\(x\)

2

\(x\)

\(x^2\)

\(2x\)

9

\(9x\)

18

  • \((x − 2)(x − 9)\)
  • \((x + 2)(x + 9)\)
  • \((x + 2)(x − 9)\)
  • \(x(x + 18)\)

Answer: \((x + 2)(x + 9)\)

  1. An expression in standard form is shown. The diagram below shows it is equivalent to which expression in factored form?

\(x^2− 12x + 35\)


 

\(x\)

–5

\(x\)

\(x^2\)

\(-5x\)

–7

\(-7x\)

35

  • \((x − 5)(x − 7)\)
  • \((x − 5)(x + 7)\)
  • \(x(x − 35)\)
  • \((x + 5)(x + 7)\)

Answer: \((x − 5)(x − 7)\)

  1. Find the factored form of \(x^2+13x +36\).
  • \((x − 12)(x − 3)\)
  • \((x + 12)(x + 1)\)
  • \((x + 18)(x + 2)\)
  • \((x + 9)(x + 4)\)

Answer: \((x + 9)(x + 4)\)

  1. Find the factored form of \(x^2−14x +48\).
  • \((x − 10)(x − 4)\)
  • \((x − 12)(x − 4)\)
  • \((x − 7)(x − 7)\)
  • \((x − 6)(x − 8)\)

Answer: \((x − 6)(x − 8)\)

  1. Find the factored form of \(x^2+13x +30\).
  • \((x + 15)(x + 2)\)
  • \((x + 6)(x + 5)\)
  • \((x + 3)(x + 10)\)
  • \((x + 6)(x + 7)\)

Answer: \((x + 3)(x + 10)\)

  1. Find the factored form of \(x^2−12x +27\).
  • \((x − 9)(x − 3)\)
  • \((x − 7)(x − 5)\)
  • \((x − 27)(x − 1)\)
  • \((x − 6)(x − 6)\)

Answer: \((x − 9)(x − 3)\)

  1. Find the factored form of \(x^2−13x +22\).
  • \((x − 11)(x − 2)\)
  • \((x − 12)(x − 1)\)
  • \((x − 22)(x − 1)\)
  • \((x − 6)(x − 7)\)

Answer: \((x − 11)(x − 2)\)

  1. Here are pairs of equivalent expressions: one in standard form and the other in factored form. Find the missing numbers.

\(x^2+20x +96\) and \((x\; +\) __\()(x \;+\) __\()\)

  • 10, 10
  • 12, 8
  • 24, 4
  • 14, 6

Answer: 12, 8
